Articles.Content:
System of kerbin is not wide but has some great moons to visit.

Well, Kerbin itself was formed in the same nebula where most of the planets formed. When kerbin was a planetoid there was still mass that orbited it and it was the beginning of the mun. Soil analysis taught us that mun was not part of kerbin and not debris from cataclysmic collision. It is unique and different from kerbin. Stable, low orbit is a sign of natural satellite.

Although minmus may be a remnant of collision due to inclination and eccentricity of orbit. It is made of ice, which is the same ice that was on kerbin hundreds of years ago. Also evidence of that is an unique and strange shape of its surface. There is a large crater on the surface of kerbin that could be the place where minmus started forming

Kerbin was in ice age long time ago when sun was just a YY dwarf. We can see evidence of that in the ice caps and oxygen in the atmosphere. But when the sun staged and turned into yellow dwarf all the ice evaporated or turned into water.

Life on kerbin consist of trees, grass and kerbals. But kerbin is not so old and still suffers from radiation and instant asteroid collisions. But when the space around will calm down, more species will come , more trees will grow , more grass to rise. But for now kerbal community must protect the planet and don’t let life go extinct…

We may find frozen bacteria or viruses deep inside minmus crust. They can be both cure and death to kerbals. All minmus surface samples must be carefully contained and never lost, sold or eaten by kerbanouts.

 

All 5 themes are for discussion. Just write Number of theme and discuss or improve them.

 

P.S All of those are theories and maybe be not true facts .

P.S 2 im Russian and english is (apperently) not my native language.

1. Plausible theory, even for Earth, i think.

2. Also, pretty plausible. It is possible that the asteroid hit when water was around on Kerbin. Wich explains the ice. Minmus also is sprinkled with Copper Oxide, wich is still unexplained on how it got there, but it is there.

3. Like Snowball Earth?

4. I think that Kerbin has been through the situation we have now on Earth, a Mass Extinction, wich explains the lack of life on Kerbin.

5. Like Snowball Earth?
